column1: This year has been a challenge but there is always a reason to be thankful. I’m grateful for my health food on the table and my family this Thanksgiving. From the Johnson family to yours – Happy Thanksgiving South Dakota! https://t.co/H1WOXUPD85
Hy-Vee in Sioux Falls is putting together hundreds of meals ahead of Thanksgiving. I was able to join the assembly line this morning. https://t.co/xGZ1dVF76L
@cullenjwilson Cullen the President tweeted earlier today that GSA should begin transition activities. Dusty has the same stance on the transition as President Trump does.
@JohnGrosz John the President announced today the GSA should begin transition activities. The President’s stance and Dusty’s stance on this issue are the same.

In the days after the election I supported the President’s right to make his case to the courts. These efforts have not been successful and it’s time for the administration to begin the transition process. https://t.co/nMflwBzdKY
Like most South Dakotans I want to keep our schools open and our economy strong. If we don’t get COVID-19 under control that’s going to be increasingly difficult. Read more ⬇️ https://t.co/N1hY7VQKWN
@KevinWoster 28 gauge
@KevinWoster Ask and you shall receive https://t.co/irDOHhVMKz

@KevinWoster Yes this was overstated. I wish Twitter allowed edits.   To answer your question my middle son likes to shoot trap after I’m done working. Since moving the clocks it’s been too dark to do so.

Is anyone else tired of it being pitch black at 4:30pm? I am. This week I signed onto the Sunshine Protection Act to eliminate the “fall back” daylight savings time change. Do you support getting rid of time changes?
Thank you to everyone who joined tonight’s telephone town hall. Great questions!
SOUTH DAKOTA! Join me tomorrow evening for a telephone town hall. I want to hear directly from you. 📞⬇️ https://t.co/9sHjyXPj7X
COVID-19 PSA: Let’s keep our economy growing and our schools open. Wash your hands watch your distance and wear a mask. #MaskUpSD RT⬇️ https://t.co/Xlf9HzyWsu
.@WillMortenson shares wisdom explaining he’s wearing a mask to protect those around him.   https://t.co/KCcGSQj7bF

Last month I subbed for my local school district for this very reason. If we want our schools to remain open we all have to step up. If you have extra time please reach out to your school district and inquire about substitute teaching.  https://t.co/ELJyfCyIWJ

ICYMI: The Impact Aid Coronavirus Relief Act is headed to the president's desk. It ensures that Federal Impact Aid for public schools with high concentrations of children of U.S. servicemembers and tribal land will not be adversely affected by COVID-19. https://t.co/O5AfszwjET
2021 CRP signups are just around the corner. Signups for general CRP will be open from Jan. 4 – Feb. 12. Learn more ⬇️https://t.co/qRA5sQp2oF
ICYMI: I break down the importance of the Electoral College with @ASP ⬇️ https://t.co/GjRPaBFHUg

I spent Veterans Day at @usd to dedicate Patriots Plaza. It commemorates the first 100 years of the Army ROTC at USD pays tribute to USD’s three Congressional Medal of Honor recipients and honors our great servicemembers both past and present. https://t.co/Uf7CY3S6NH
Thank you to those who served our great nation. Happy Veterans Day South Dakota. https://t.co/rBL9bylbpz
South Dakota’s @SenJohnThune has been re-elected Senate Whip. Crack that Whip! https://t.co/Q2k1dJDJ4N
Spending another morning with Strider Bikes on their “All Kids Bike” campaign. But first we assemble! https://t.co/AGUG4l3c3U

I also joined the Strider Bikes Foundation in Pierre and Fort Pierre. They donated 22 bikes per school as apart of their All Kids Bike campaign. It was a joy to see some of these kids ride their first bike! https://t.co/2wTcjKObNA

Spent the morning with the school in Kimball to go over the Farm and Ranch to to School Act I introduced in Congress. This bill ensure schools have easier access to local South Dakota beef and better understand where their food comes from. https://t.co/cqUpyUt6fX
@barbarasoderlin @KevinWoster @RepDonBacon

I visited the 3M facility in Aberdeen to celebrate its expansion. 3M has consistently stepped up during this pandemic providing PPE to millions of Americans. This expansion is great - I’m confident lives will be saved because of the increased ability to produce PPE here at home. https://t.co/kRdOUTFsFC

@CarlaClarke1 @SenJohnThune @SenatorRounds @govkristinoem Carla just to be clear . . . it’s the House Committee on Administration that made the decision to deploy staffers to Pennsylvania. The bipartisan committee began training for situations like this weeks ago.

@JenHyk Jennifer I did not make this decision to dispatch staff.   This is a program administered by the bipartisan House Committee on Administration. I’ll let the committee know you are worried for them.

Understanding the importance of election integrity weeks ago two of my staff members began training as non-partisan official election observers. Tomorrow they will be dispatched by the House to PA. It’s important legal ballots be counted and improper ballots be investigated.

ATTN RANCHERS: USDA is hosting a free webinar on livestock risk management. Risk management training for producers is something I’m fighting for in the PRICE Act. The webinar is scheduled for 1-2 p.m. CT on Thursday November 12. Producers can register at https://t.co/6ZoJSowgcp.
https://t.co/8uo1rYAfOF
Today I attended the Sisseton Wahpeton Oyate Tribal Council meeting. We discussed COVID-19 relief and testing road conditions IHS and my tribal efforts in Congress. https://t.co/1C6PBREllj
@r2sure @talbit Yes 100% true. Sharp cheddar is beautiful and mild cheddar is an abomination.

The rail line from Sisseton-Milbank provides critical access for corn & soybeans to enter the market. Despite its importance some of this rail has never been replaced. My office has been working to secure funds to fix this. This rail is 150 years old--time for some improvements. https://t.co/PscB7LTrNL

First stop today is the Valley Queen Cheese factory in Milbank. The dairy industry is responsible for more than 12000 jobs in South Dakota. Take a look at just a few ways VQ is protecting their workers during COVID-19⬇️ https://t.co/HdORrhfVIS
https://t.co/Gi6HPF0TOE
The boys and I geared up for a day of hunting. Don’t forget your gear when you’re indoors too! https://t.co/Lh6ssCFY4Q

Good news! The Oglala Yankton Rosebud and Cheyenne River Sioux Tribes were all granted licenses to address tribes’ internet connectivity needs. This is a strong step towards closing the digital divide on our tribal lands. https://t.co/fpNnORAorN

I spent yesterday in Spearfish meeting with local leaders and small business owners. We discussed what worked in the CARES Act COVID-19 relief package and what didn’t. Their input helps me best understand what’s really needed in South Dakota. https://t.co/EfsLE0LVC9

And finally 5. These educators aren’t teaching one class at a time. They are teaching a “normal” one one to students working remotely one to students with limited English proficiency one to students who are absent because of activities etc.   Be grateful for great teachers.
4. My middle schooler told me this morning not to “ruin his reputation.” His friends in the last block of the day told me I did okay so I think I’m in the clear.
3. Teachers are incredibly passionate about what they do just as they were back in my student days. Their biggest beef? Parents who aren’t engaged.
2. Teaching to remote learners is not easy. I’m not saying it isn’t a part of the answer. I’m just saying it’s harder.
A few observations from my great day as a #MiddleSchoolSubstitute:  1. These kids are great. Some people say the future is bleak. Maybe but these kids have tons of potential.

For anyone who thinks being out of the classroom is a “day off” for the teacher please note that the teacher I’m subbing for had FIVE PAGES of detailed notes for me specific to today’s classes. It’s obvious that @allipierson is an incredible educator. #MiddleSchoolSubstitute https://t.co/RwFPRuxKfZ
Another complexity added by COVID . . . most in-person instructional blocks also have students learning remotely so educators need to use that technology in real time. https://t.co/5kEPNTXslw

Aside from social distancing and mask wearing there are other COVID-19 precautions in place. For example we disinfect surfaces at the end of every block. #MiddleSchoolSubstitute https://t.co/uPyCsegunu
School lunch of sweet chili chicken.  Before and after. #MiddleSchoolSubstitute https://t.co/HyJSo3WZiz
Middle school has gotten rough and tumble in the last 30 years. An eighth grader just called me a “silly goose.” #MiddleSchoolSubstitute
If I would have known we’d be discussing the Hazelwood First Amendment case in Yearbook this morning I would have had someone from @SD_Newspapers guest lecture!  #MiddleSchoolSubstitute
I’m working today as a substitute middle school English teacher. #Nervous https://t.co/hKOVHb9bf5
I have two of these spectacular drawings hanging in South Dakota’s Congressional office in Washington. Congrats John! https://t.co/COIsO94kMg
@choffman_ I’ve expressed concerns about Russian interference on numerous occasions.  https://t.co/pEKmihICnN
@briannabernard @choffman_ Clay has his tweets protected so I can’t see the comment you are referring to but thanks for saying “hi” 😊.
🚨 🚨 🚨 Today is the LAST DAY to respond to the #2020Census. Get counted! Visit https://t.co/Kbb8mmnTvb to fill out your census.

@elgallo7 @KevinWoster Well even the CEO of Twitter acknowledged that their handling of this was “unacceptable.” It seems like it’s a pretty fair day to ask what appropriate rules of the road should look like.

@elgallo7 @KevinWoster JMM I didn’t frame it around any particular fact set. I tweeted it today because our country is talking about this issue (at least a little) today. It’s a worthy conversation. We shouldn’t see this as a “Biden thing” or a “Trump thing.”  It isn’t.
@KevinWoster If you think these questions don’t have any legitimate importance or currency you aren’t being thoughtful enough about the future of public discourse.
@KevinWoster When Big Tech has the power of a “publisher” but the liability of a “platform” that creates a situation that we need to examine.

@KevinWoster Kevin I’m serious. We need to think about what the proper regulatory regime looks like in this new era. Senators on both sides of the aisle have asked questions in this arena when Big Tech has testified.

Sign-ups for the 2021 Agriculture Risk Coverage and Price Loss Coverage Programs opened yesterday and close on March 15th. For more information about the programs contact your local FSA office at https://t.co/qcBBoLVumW or click below⬇️ https://t.co/qZyhuH4F4Y
We need to seriously evaluate how much control social media giants have over civic discourse. Congress has to decide what to do when legitimate news is being blocked.
I even got to join the students for a game of tag after our meal. https://t.co/pcZwX1reDs
Another great day of school lunch...today’s brought to you by Hill City Elementary. #NationalSchoolLunchWeek🥗 https://t.co/4yT17043Iw

Kicked off National School Lunch Week at Francis Case Elementary School in Box Elder. School lunch is critical to our students success and as a member of the Education & Labor Committee I’m looking forward to taking what I learned today back to Washington. https://t.co/yKEeU5ueAs

Happy Native American Day. South Dakota’s culture runs deep with indigenous ancestry and I was honored to highlight this ancestry by speaking Lakota on the House floor last year. https://t.co/8i04dlY4c1
@GOPKMA George the CDC guidance is clear that “close contact” is six feet for 15 minutes.
@GOPKMA https://t.co/SKLS7ew1QD
It was an privilege to honor Vietnam Veterans from my childhood hometown of Pierre yesterday. I’m grateful for their service to our nation. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/1b0hIQt8JE

As the push for D.C. statehood continues Congress should consider alternatives that not only make sense for the residents of D.C. but also for the nation as a whole. Read more about my bill⬇️  https://t.co/EZHRA8IUf0

Today I introduced the District of Columbia-Maryland Reunion Act. The Founders never intended statehood for our nation’s capital. Rather than create a new state out of D.C. it makes more sense to return suburban areas back to the original state that possessed them Maryland.

Since the onset of the coronavirus many different aspects of the beef supply chain have received scrutiny...COVID-19 is turning its attention to an issue some say is ripe for radical reshaping: the beef cattle industry. -@Spencer_Chase Read more about the PRICE Act⬇️ https://t.co/TBvo8fNIKF
Thank you for your support @LindseyGrahamSC! The Problem Solvers worked hard on this proposal - I’m confident we can get a deal done with this framework. https://t.co/53PrqxHODK

— including by the Administration. We cannot overstate how important it is that leaders in both parties — along with the President — return to the table and agree on a package that will provide immediate relief to families and businesses. Inaction is not an option.

American families & America's small businesses are hurting and cannot afford more delays — especially when a deal is within reach. The 25 Democrats + 25 Republicans of the Problem Solvers Caucus have already crafted a bipartisan framework for relief that has been widely supported
Thanks to all who rolled through the drive-thru town hall today. I also toured Presentation College and got to see their COVID-19 precautions firsthand. Great day in Aberdeen! https://t.co/HnVDoLYngq

ICYMI: The PRICE Act is gaining support in the House and amongst national cattle groups. I'm proud so many of my colleagues see the writing on the wall and support real help for cattle country. https://t.co/KAsJLGXw16

ABERDEEN! Join me today at 11:30am for a "Drive-Thru Dusty" Town Hall. I'll be at the new Fairfield Inn parking lot and I want to hear from you! Please stop by if you have a question need help with a federal casework issue or just want to say hello. See you soon! https://t.co/8xeGVu5v7W

Thank you @SenatorRounds for introducing the Senate companion of the COVID-19 Telehealth Program Extension Act. @RepSpanberger and I are glad to see efforts to further strengthen telehealth across the country are gaining momentum in the Senate! https://t.co/oR1Azwdx9G
Mr. President South Dakota wishes you and @FLOTUS a speedy recovery. https://t.co/lRQAlPEh0g

Thank you to @ConawayTX11 @RepDarrenSoto @CongressmanGT  @RogerMarshallMD @RepCuellar @RepFrankLucas @GregForMontana @RepDavidRouzer @RepRickCrawford @RepJasonSmith @RepTomEmmer & @RepHagedorn for leading this effort for our ranchers.

Cattle country is hurting and has not fully recovered. @USDA laid out several areas where Congress can implement real solutions to improve the market – the PRICE Act is the answer to many of the issues our ranchers have faced for years. https://t.co/hYZ9q2P0KM

Ben Reifel is a role model. His service to Indian Country and to our nation deserves to be honored in South Dakota. I’m grateful my bill to rename the Rosebud Post Office passed the House of Representatives this week. https://t.co/6OS9V1hoCs
@michaelagoldamm Note to self:  When I’m in a bad mood I need to just stop and remember that Michaela Goldammer is a real person out there somewhere making people smile.
@frebodar https://t.co/GINC923yNT

Two weeks ago Republicans & Democrats came together to unveil a bipartisan relief package. Today the Speaker unveiled a package that spends $1 trillion too much doesn’t fix the UI problem & provides tax cuts for millionaires in high-tax states. We need a plan that is bipartisan
Important update on the Paycheck Protection Program⬇️ https://t.co/HpmJKSXmkD

The Conservation and Forestry Subcommittee just began a hearing - The 2020 Wildfire Year: Response and Recovery Efforts. I’ll be speaking on South Dakota’s strong forestry management efforts. Watch here ⬇️https://t.co/z1NoYrBjBK

America is an innovative nation. That innovation often outpaces the federal regulatory environment. The Digital Commodity Exchange Act ensures Americans can have confidence in emerging financial tools. Proud to introduce this bill with my colleague @ConawayTX11.
The peaceful transition of power is a hallmark of our American system of government.
@billymcmacken @David_Bordewyk @SD_Newspapers Yes it is!
If we want a free society we have to support a free press. Democracy demands journalism. https://t.co/kyc9abfqQy
South Dakota Producers! Do you have questions about CFAP Round 2? Join the @USDA CFAP webinar tomorrow to learn more. Sign up here: https://t.co/8jQWHdl10E

Congrats to South Dakota’s 2020 Small Business award winners! More than 50% of South Dakotans are employed by a small business – from the local grocer to the pizza shop on main street – they are the lifeblood of our communities. #SmallBusinessWeek https://t.co/IbDXWkfuYP

The U.S. House passed my bill - the Tribal School Federal Insurance Parity Act - unanimously today. This bill directs critical $ back to tribal students. For 10 years leaders have tried to make this fix & I’m grateful for the chance to work with tribal leaders to get this done. https://t.co/9FILihRgnG
For the second time this year Ag producers are being left out of a spending package. We should stop playing games with Farm Bill programs. Congress needs to fund the CCC as a part of the CR.
Don’t forget our drive-through town hall until 3 pm today Rapid City! https://t.co/wzyxG7CDVQ
Small in stature RBG will always be a towering figure in Supreme Court History. Rest In Peace.
See you tomorrow Rapid City! https://t.co/zzkwPsZJLl

@JakeSherman https://t.co/dDGbiquzVM

More than a 1.5 million American Indian & Alaska Native women have experienced violence throughout their lifetimes. Nearly 6000 of these same women have been reported missing. Congress can’t ignore this issue - we need to pass the Savanna’s Act today. #MMIW https://t.co/6aSSRoB5ZN
Thank you @GrowthEnergy! I'm proud to be a supporter of South Dakota's biofuels industry. https://t.co/KU0MEazimp

Thank you to the 25 Republicans and the 25 Democrats of the @ProbSolveCaucus that stepped up to create a framework forward for COVID-19 relief. Agreement is possible and these folks share the value that Congress is supposed to do its job. https://t.co/g2DBQBUqlo

Today the Problem Solvers Caucus unveiled a bipartisan framework for the next COVID-19 relief bill. This is how Congress is supposed to work. When this group set aside the political games the 'March to Common Ground' became very clear. https://t.co/baRQdo6rUW

I’m encouraged the administration is denying refinery blending waivers. We need to protect the RFS. The biofuels industry also needs long-term certainty - I’ll keep pushing for the RFS Integrity Act to ensure our producers aren’t disadvantaged. https://t.co/asRxUAgayf

Thanks to @SecWilkie for confirming that he will rescind the VA’s 2017 Record of Decision today. The Hot Springs VA will be a place of healing for our veterans for decades to come! https://t.co/1a3pSKfBPA

19 years since Americans watched in shock as our nation was attacked in broad daylight. We will never forget the 2977 brothers&sisters we lost on 9/11. America is strong. Americans are resilient during the toughest times. There will always be more that unites us than divides us.

The VA is hosting a South Dakota Veteran benefits telephone town hall tomorrow at 4pm CT/3pm MT. If you have questions about your benefits — please join tomorrow’s town hall!  Participant Dial-In: 833-380-0417 To ask a question dial *3  https://t.co/iPbXbIqnA0
I’ve really enjoyed meeting so many of South Dakota’s Veterans this summer. Aberdeen is home to some of our state’s finest. https://t.co/nhdBsMgNHl
Happy Labor Day to South Dakota’s workforce. To those who have kept us going through this pandemic thank you. And to those looking for a new opportunity a new beginning is just around the corner.
As a second round of CFAP launches next week it’s important our wheat producers aren’t left behind. Thanks for leading this effort @RepFrankLucas ⬇️ https://t.co/YHN75Z0aH1

This is good news for our ranchers and a solid step towards a free-trade agreement with Taiwan. https://t.co/2k8GBWrh8p

Thank you to Monument Health and Meadowbrook Elementary for showing me how you’ve prepared for COVID-19. I’m proud of the effort by our local communities to keep South Dakotans safe. https://t.co/OUnq9EXCa1
Some of my fondest family memories come from visits to our National Parks. Happy 104th Birthday to the @NatlParkService! #FindYourPark https://t.co/xTAiaFV7F2
Tune in tonight! ⤵️ https://t.co/EITp64nKJG

I’m headed back to DC tonight to discuss postal issues. @SpeakerPelosi you should keep members in DC until we come to a COVID-19 relief agreement for the American people. Congress can’t leave hurting Americans out to dry – let’s get to work on a bill that can pass the Senate.

Today my office presented Vietnam War Commemorative Pins to eight of South Dakota’s veterans. Stephen Tim Doug John James Sandy Clare Glen and Dennis — we are so grateful for your service to our nation thank you. https://t.co/MXyBk3QmW6

A slowdown of advertisements and subsequent layoffs continue to threaten our ability to maintain a free press.  Today @collinpeterson and I introduced the PRINT Act to help alleviate some of the burden our print shops are facing. https://t.co/HSGArVEzxB

Our local news teams work day in and day out to keep South Dakotans informed of what’s happening both locally and nationally. Unfortunately local media hasn’t been immune from the financial impact of COVID-19.
Great conversation with @GrowthEnergy on biofuels⬇️ https://t.co/RkjGlHMM5M

100 years. I’m grateful for the women who paved the way for equal rights and for those who continue to do so today. We’ve come a long way as a nation and I’m proud to live in a country that recognizes the tremendous contributions women make each and every day.  #19thAmendment

South Dakota producers will be allowed to hay graze or chop cover crops on prevented plant acres beginning September 1 in 19 counties. This flexibility is needed and I'm glad @USDA recognized the importance of our request.  https://t.co/3mP7NCfQh9

Harold Thune was truly one of a kind. My sympathies to Senator Thune and his family. https://t.co/K1FHFCLcLq

This is a great step towards further peace in the Middle East. Thank you to the Trump Administration for working diligently to broker this deal. https://t.co/GDgTLK25Jd

I’ve been reviewing the legal basis for the President’s executive orders following Congress’ failure to act. Some are more problematic than others. We are a constitutional republic & separation of powers matters. Congress shouldn’t rely on executive authority to govern our nation

Moving Election Day would seriously jeopardize the legitimacy of the election. Federal state and local officials need to continue to work hard to ensure that Americans can vote safely whether by voting early or on November 3.

South Dakota patients deserve quality care - that's why @RepSpanberger and I introduced a bill to provide the resources needed to strengthen additional telehealth programs in South Dakota and across the country. https://t.co/GpZRoV2hnT
South Dakota has seen the benefits of expanding telehealth firsthand. It’s easy it’s quick and it protects vulnerable populations seeking health care during this worldwide health crisis.

Education & work are the key to upward mobility. Unfortunately today House Democrats voted to prohibit future administration’s from requiring young single able-bodied welfare recipients to work or attend school. I spoke on the House floor on why this isn’t the right approach. https://t.co/T5t91SiMjk

Here's what is expected in the next COVID-19 relief bill:  ☑️ Additional stimulus check for Americans ☑️ Funding for schools & childcare centers ☑️ Tax incentives for businesses to train new workers ☑️ Investment for testing & a vaccine https://t.co/tqwmiPISIk

I’m grateful the White House is hosting the Task Force on Protecting Native American Children today. It’s so important we prioritize our tribal communities. “Strong Native American communities are strong American communities.” Thank you @FLOTUS https://t.co/Hm5LH6jUPB

When patients were no longer allowed to visit hospitals in-person for regular appointments we needed a solution – and fast. Telehealth was the answer. @RepSpanberger and I want to see these crucial services continue. @FCC https://t.co/9hkJjhnUod
@Kyle_Rokeh Kyle it was great talking to you today. Thanks for taking the time to say “hi.” Thanks also for working the games!

“I will come over the meet you brother.” My colleague John Lewis has died. This scene from the House floor last year beautifully captures who John was. A principled gentleman always willing to take steps toward his brothers and sisters.  Our nation could use more more of that. https://t.co/YilWWl6JxF
Happy 50th Twist Cone! Here's a throwback from last summer's town hall at the Twist Cone. https://t.co/8Cp0QQSChO https://t.co/sz4RehSg2l

A Starting Point officially launches today and I’m proud to be a part of it. Check it out ⬇️ https://t.co/6CWS5g5MYP @ASP

Our nation needs less fighting & more engaging– @ASP is a go-to platform where the people can hear directly from politicians on policy & ideas – it fosters conversation we don’t normally see between political parties. You get to hear both sides from Republicans & Democrats. (1/2)

America can’t be caught unprepared again. COVID-19 exposed the cracks in our meat supply chains – Foot and Mouth disease could take the same toll. I’m glad to see Farm Bill dollars going to prevent a potential outbreak. https://t.co/a1799vXmEb

Nearly 34% of all jobs that were lost because of COVID-19 are back up and running. We still have a ways to go but I’m glad to see our economy is beginning to bounce back as we continue to fight through this pandemic.
